title: Projects
text:
2025
Forced Turnover: Evaluating Pressing Effectiveness in Soccer (Jul 2025)  Carnegie Mellon Sports Analytics Camp  A Machine Learning approach to analyze pressing in soccer with player tracking data from 520 MLS matches.  Partner: Natalie Rayce (Carnegie Mellon University), Daniel Wicker (Charlotte FC)  Paper | Poster | Slides | GitHub
Data Analytics Externship | Consumer Insights & Strategic Decision-Making (Jun 2025)  Beats by Dre  An analysis on Beats’ in the wireless speaker market, analyzing 4,628 consumer survey responses for business recommendations.  Slides | Dashboard
NBA Honors Selections 2024-25 Season (May 2025)  Predicting NBA honors (All-NBA, All-Defensive, All-Rookie) using regular-season box score statistics.  Partner: Vedant Bhong  Slides | GitHub | College News
2025 Cincinnati Reds Baseball Analytics Student Hackathon (Feb 2025)  [insert description]  Kaggle Notebook | GitHub …


2024
National Olympic Performance: Analyzing Economic, Demographic, and Historical Determinants of Summer Olympics Medal Counts (Dec 2024)  Econometrics Final Paper  Paper | GitHub/Stata
Minesweeper (Dec 2024)  My attempt at recreating the classic Minesweeper game using Python.

title: David Almona
text:
Welcome! I’m Almona, a final year undergraduate student at Centre College studying Economics with a minor in Data Science. I enjoy working on data analysis and statistical modeling problems and applying these skills to real-world data.
Feel free to look at my resume and projects I have worked on.
I’m also on the track & field team, competing mainly in the 100m and 200m.
Fun fact: I have studied in three countries - Nigeria, South Africa, and now the US.
